content: कारक {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (रिका|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [कृ-ण्वुल्] (Usually at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>) {@--1@} Making, acting, doing, performing, creating, doer &c.; स्वप्नस्य कारकः <ls>Y. 3. 150</ls>; <ls n="Y.">2. 156</ls>; वर्णसंकरकारकैः <ls>Bg. 1. 42</ls>; <ls>Ms. 7. 204</ls>; <ls>Pt. 5. 36.</ls> {@--2@} An agent. {@--3@} Intending to act or do. --कं {@--1@} (In <ab>gram.</ab>) The relation subsisting between a noun and a verb in a sentence, (or between a noun and other words governing it); there are six such Kārakas, belonging to the first seven cases, except the genitive: (1) कर्तृ; (2) कर्मन्; (3); करण; (4) संप्रदान; (5) अपादान; (6) अधिकरण. {@--2@} That part of grammar which treats of these relations; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} syntax. {@--3@} Water produced from hail.
